snippet: Had history unfolded differently, visitors to Central Park would have seen a statue of Mary Poppins alongside the Alice in Wonderland and Hans Christian Andersen statues.
abstract: Had history unfolded differently, visitors to Central Park would have seen a statue of Mary Poppins alongside the Alice in Wonderland and Hans Christian Andersen statues.
lead_paragraph: If things had turned out differently 45 years ago, Mark Bransdon might have been looking at a life-size statue of Mary Poppins in Central Park, a few steps from the familiar statues of Hans Christian Andersen and Alice, of "Alice in Wonderland."

headline.main: When New York Snubbed Mary Poppins
